author: Skut
title: A great car that does not look like a Ferrari
review:
Let's get one thing straight from the start.  With the possible exception of the Porsche 911, the Speed Champions cars do not look like the real cars they are based on.  However as you will see, that doesn't mean they aren't great. 

The 458 Italia GT2 is a case in point.  Nothing that looked like this model ever came out of the prancing horse factory.  The overall lines of the car are much more like a modern Ford Mustang or other muscle car.  The impression is more of a WRC car than a GT - perhaps Lego could bring out a line of WRC cars or Nascars with more realism, given the geometry of the brick?

However despite the above limitations, the ground-hugging bodywork, clever use of SNOT and offset building techniques and part colours make this an eminently cool car - indeed the 2015 Race Champions sets are the best minifig-scale racing cars TLG has produced so far.  The only parts limitation (common across this year's Race Champions sets) seems to be a propensity to use stickers for headlights rather than brick-built ones.  Indeed there are lots of stickers in this set full stop, so this is not a set for you if you're a member of the anti-sticker brigade. 

This 458 looks particularly intimidating as it roars down the main street of your city, leaving the poor pathetic City police cars in its dust. 

Buy it for the play value, colours and parts.  Don't buy it if you want a Lego car that looks like a Ferrari.

author: Gerbil
title: Fantastic looking and fun to build!
review:
I'm not much of a racing car fan, I follow Formula 1 and nothing else really, but when I saw these they intrigued me because they looked so polished. One build later, and...

Pros:

  • Looks absolutely fabulous
  • The stickers really add to the set, and I can count on the fingers of one hand how many times I've said that about a LEGO set.
  • A complicated and interesting build for its size.
  • The final build is surprisingly and satisfyingly weighty.

Cons:

  • Doesn't quite fit in with other city vehicules due to the slightly larger size.
  • A lot of stickers - if you dislike placing them or don't stick them for fear of warping, you are going to end up with a really boring looking car :(

Overall opinion:

This lived up to and surpassed my expectations. The piece selection is fantastic with a lot of nice plates, curves and SNOT pieces, and the build itself is interesting with a few unusual building techniques. The double SNOT brackets to create the downward facing tiles between the wheels is nothing short of elegant because of its simplicity. The stickers, while generally a much-hated part of my sets, work extremely well here, and the final model feels like a real, sponsored-to-the-hilt race car. Overall this set oozes quality.

author: tmdguru500
title: Beautiful car, easy to build
review:
I bought this one to add to my lego car collection. 

In terms of building it, it was relatively straightforward. Well it was my 7 year old son who was building it and he had no problems at all. The only challenge were the stickers. There were quite a few and some quite technical. 

Anyways, the car does look beautiful. 

I guess at the end of the day, the price of this was a tad high. I guess its all to do with the sponsorships and Ferrari-related stickers. 

All-in-all, a good set.
